intro: Zeltnera multicaulis, commonly known as the multibract zeltnera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its basal leaves are often lobed, and the stems are covered in fine hairs, providing structural support and reducing water loss. Zeltnera multicaulis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
